articles.description: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag dismisses Cristiano Ronaldo’s latest criticism and says the outside noise around the club does not bother him.
articles.title: Manchester United boss Erik ten Hag rejects Ronaldo criticism

articles.description: Lando Norris says he wants to try to earn the world title on merit, despite McLaren asking his team-mate Oscar Piastri to support the Briton if necessary.
articles.title: Lando Norris: McLaren driver wants to earn F1 title on merit, despite new team orders

articles.description: Centre Emily Scarratt will start her 100th game for England on Saturday against New Zealand in the first fixture at the newly-named Allianz Stadium.
articles.title: England v New Zealand: Emily Scarratt to start her 100th Red Roses game

articles.description: Man City's trial on 115 charges of breaking Premier League rules is set to begin. BBC Sport looks at why it matters and how we got here.
articles.title: Man City hearing: Premier League 115 charges case set to begin

articles.description: The disappearance of France under-18 international Medhi Narjissi was partly caused by a poorly-organised recovery session, an investigation by the country's rugby federation (FFR) has concluded.
articles.title: Medhi Narjissi: Recovery session was 'poorly-controlled'

articles.description: Jon Rahm improves his chance of playing in next year's Ryder Cup by appealing against the fines imposed on him by the DP World Tour.
articles.title: Ryder Cup 2025: Jon Rahm of LIV contests DP World Tour fines

articles.description: Australia will be competitive against the British and Irish Lions in 2025 despite poor recent results, says Rugby Australia chief Phil Waugh.
articles.title: British and Irish Lions: Wallabies will be ready for 2025 - Waugh

articles.description: British fans are urged by Davis Cup captain Leon Smith to act "like a football crowd" in Manchester to help them get through.
articles.title: Davis Cup 2024: Great Britain need 'football crowd' behind them in Manchester - Leon Smith

articles.description: American businessman John Textor is making "progress" in his bid to buy Everton but the club have said there is "some work to be done to complete the transaction".
articles.title: Everton takeover: John Textor making 'progress' but 'work to be done' say club

articles.description: Arne Slot has managed something at Liverpool that Jurgen Klopp achieved only once in eight seasons. But how do they compare?
articles.title: Liverpool: Arne Slot v Jurgen Klopp - how they compare
